Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • ePortfolio.Portfolio
  • public class Portfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    A Portfolio Object. A Portfolio Object contains the parameters and functionalities of a portfolio containing two different types of investments.

                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> index)
        Portfolio constructor. Parameters:
        Parameters:
        invst - - An arraylist holding all investments in the ePortfolio.
        index - - A hashmap that maps strings to an arraylist of integers, holding indices of keywords.

      • buyInvst

        public java.lang.String buyInvst​(java.lang.String type,
                                 java.lang.String symbol,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String quant,
                                 java.lang.String p)
        Method for buying an investment and adding it to the Arraylist or Hashmap. The investment added will either be a Stock or a MutualFund. Parameters:
        Parameters:
        type - - determines whether investment will be Stock or MutualFund.
        symbol - - short version of string name.
        name - - a string that describes the investment company.
        quant - - the amount of units a user can buy.
        p - - the amount one units is worth.
        Returns:
        - string containing output to the message box.

      • sellInvst

        public java.lang.String sellInvst​(java.lang.String symbol,
                                  java.lang.String quant,
                                  java.lang.String p)
        Method for selling an investment, calculating gain/loss, and/or removing it to the Arraylist or Hashmap. The investment sold will either be a Stock or a MutualFund. Parameters:
        Parameters:
        symbol - - short version of string name. Determines the investment.
        quant - - the amount of units a user can buy.
        p - - the amount one units is worth.
        Returns:
        - string containing output to the message box.

      • updateInvst

        public java.lang.String updateInvst​(java.lang.String p,
                                    int count)
        Method for updating any investment, by inputting a new price. Calculates gain and changes bookValue based on the price change. Parameters:
        Parameters:
        p - - the amount one units is worth.
        count - - index passed to determine which item on the Arraylist must be updated.
        Returns:
        - string containing output to the message box.

      • getGainInvst

        public double getGainInvst​(int count)
        Method for outputting the gain of any investments.
        Parameters:
        count - - index passed to determine from which item on the Arraylist the user wants the gain value.
        Returns:
        - double containing the gain of the chosen investment.

      • searchInvst

        public java.util.ArrayList<Investment> searchInvst​(java.lang.String symbol,
                                                   java.lang.String keywords,
                                                   double lPrice,
                                                   double hPrice)
        Method for search implementation throughout the Arraylist. The investment will be found based on a single or combination of inputs containing a symbol, keywords, and/or price ranges. Parameters:
        Parameters:
        symbol - - short version of string name. Investment identified through symbol.
        keywords - - a string that describes the investment company.
        lPrice - - the lower end of a price range.
        hPrice - - the higher end of a price range.
        Returns:
        - The Arraylist containing all objects that have satisfied search requirements.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
        Equals method. Checks if one object is equivalent to the other.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - - An object wanted to be compared against.
        Returns:
        - A boolean that will be true if objects are equivalent, and false if they are not.
